title: How to Make Macaroni and Cheese Donuts

steps.headline: Chill the macaroni and cheese.
steps.description: Place the cooked macaroni and cheese in a large bowl, scraping it out using a rubber spatula. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in fridge to chill and slightly harden, usually taking about 2-4 hours.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius.
Process and blend the macaroni with the eggs.
steps.description: Remove the macaroni from the fridge. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the macaroni and cheese into a food processor. Crack in the three eggs, one at a time, and then place the food processor onto medium. Blend for about two minutes until properly mixed.

steps.headline: Spray the donut pan with non-stick greasing spray.
steps.description: Prepare the donut pan by spraying non-stick greasing into each cavity. This helps to ensure that the donuts won't stick to the pan. If you don't have non-stick greasing spray you can also spread melted butter over the pan using a pastry brush.

steps.headline: Scoop the macaroni into the cavities.
steps.description: Using a spoon, scoop the macaroni and cheese into the donut pan. Fill each cavity to the top and lightly pattern it with the spoon to spread it around. Repeat until the donut pan is full and there is no more macaroni.

steps.headline: Bake the donuts for about 20 minutes.
steps.description: Before frying, the donuts must bake in order to keep their shape. Have the donuts bake until they are lightly crisped and the edges turn burn.

steps.headline: Let the donuts cool.
steps.description: Remove the donuts from the oven and have them cool for about five minutes. It's important to have the donuts cool to avoid having them burn and blacken while frying.

steps.headline: Preheat the oil to 350° Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius.
steps.description: While the donuts cool, prepare the pot or deep fryer with oil. Have it preheat until the oil is hot and starts to slightly bubble.

steps.headline: Fry the donuts.
steps.description: Using tongs, place the donuts into the hot oil. Have them fry for about 7-10 minutes, until they crisp and resemble a light brown color. Remove the donuts using the tongs and place them on a serving plate covered with a napkin.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Use the edges of napkin to soak up any excess oil from the donuts. Serve the donuts with tomato ketchup, cheese sauce, or your favorite mustard.

text: Chill the macaroni and cheese. Place the cooked macaroni and cheese in a large bowl, scraping it out using a rubber spatula. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in fridge to chill and slightly harden, usually taking about 2-4 hours. Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius.  Process and blend the macaroni with the eggs. Remove the macaroni from the fridge. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the macaroni and cheese into a food processor. Crack in the three eggs, one at a time, and then place the food processor onto medium. Blend for about two minutes until properly mixed. Spray the donut pan with non-stick greasing spray. Prepare the donut pan by spraying non-stick greasing into each cavity. This helps to ensure that the donuts won't stick to the pan. If you don't have non-stick greasing spray you can also spread melted butter over the pan using a pastry brush. Scoop the macaroni into the cavities. Using a spoon, scoop the macaroni and cheese into the donut pan. Fill each cavity to the top and lightly pattern it with the spoon to spread it around. Repeat until the donut pan is full and there is no more macaroni. Bake the donuts for about 20 minutes. Before frying, the donuts must bake in order to keep their shape. Have the donuts bake until they are lightly crisped and the edges turn burn. Let the donuts cool. Remove the donuts from the oven and have them cool for about five minutes. It's important to have the donuts cool to avoid having them burn and blacken while frying. Preheat the oil to 350° Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. While the donuts cool, prepare the pot or deep fryer with oil. Have it preheat until the oil is hot and starts to slightly bubble. Fry the donuts. Using tongs, place the donuts into the hot oil. Have them fry for about 7-10 minutes, until they crisp and resemble a light brown color. Remove the donuts using the tongs and place them on a serving plate covered with a napkin. Serve and enjoy! Use the edges of napkin to soak up any excess oil from the donuts. Serve the donuts with tomato ketchup, cheese sauce, or your favorite mustard.
